newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo stocks open weaker, depressed by Dow drop.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo stocks open weaker, depressed by Dow drop.

text.p: Tokyo stocks eased in early morning trade on Thursday, as steep losses on Wall Street overnight added to caution about recent sharp advances, brokers said.
By 0008 GMT, the 225-share Nikkei average was down 82.80 points, or 0.41 percent, at 19,966.10.
Its June futures were down 60 points to 20,020.
"The market had been overheated and it lacks active buyers," said a trader at a foreign securities house.
"But many people want to buy on dips after a period of position adjustment."
